messages.content:
The first film of Velcrow Ripper's acclaimed 'Love Evolve' trilogy, Scared Sacred is a feature documentary that asks the question: can we be Scared into the Sacred? The film takes us on a journey to the pivotal ground zeros of the world, places like Bosnia, Hiroshima, New York City and Afghanistan in search of stories of hope and meaning. 

Preceding the screening energy healer Tanis Day, PhD, will give a talk on energy awareness skills for self or healing work.

Everyone welcome!

On July 28th, 7:00 at the Original, there will be a FREE screening of Velcrow Ripper's SCARED SACRED, the first of his EVOLVE LOVE documentary trilogy.

Please join us!

Legendary singer-songwriter FERRON will be returning to the Original Princess, Friday July 29th for a rare performance. Ferron doesn't tour as much as she used to, so this show will be special. If you've never seen Ferron, don't miss this opportunity. If you have seen her, we're sure you'll be making plans to come!

Advance tickets ($28) are available at the Twin and Old Goat Books, and on-line at Eventbrite http://ferronjuly29.eventbrite.com/
or by phone at (519)880-9595 (Old Goat)

Music From the Big House, from acclaimed director Bruce McDonald (Roadkill, HWY 61) is an inspiring documentary that follows award-winnning blues musician Rita Chiarelli to Lousiana State Penitentiary, where she puts on a concert with some of the musical inmates. Music From the Big House is a powerful film about healing and the redemptive power of music. 
Tickets are available at the Twin and on-line at http://musicfromthebighouse.eventbrite.com/

CANADA FILM DAYS Closing Night Event!  7pm, May 11th.

Join us for a fantastic evening of film and music. Award-winning blues performer Rita Chiarelli teams up with iconic Canadian director Bruce McDonald (Roadkill, HWY 61) in MUSIC FROM THE BIG HOUSE, an inspiring and healing musical journey to one of America's most notorious prisons.

Rita will perform Live On Stage after the film!
Advance tickets ($25) on sale now at the Princess Twin and on-line at http://musicfromthebighouse.eventbrite.com/

It's here! The Canada Film Days Pancake Breakfast! Friday 8am-11am at the Princess Cafe. Marc is making gourmet apple pancakes (with caramelized apples), local maple syrup and cider! Event is free and open to everyone. Film announcements at 10am. Dress Canadian!

Come help us celebrate the LAUNCH of CANADA FILM DAYS in an iconic Canadian way:  A Pancake Breakfast! 
April 29th, 8am-11am at the Princess Cafe.
Film Festival announcements at 10 am. Everyone Welcome!

Pancakes for a Loonie. Maple Syrup from Bauman's Farm. Fresh Apple Cider from Martin's Farm. Dress: Canadian

CANADA FILM DAYS FESTIVAL
May 5 - May 11, 2011
A Celebration of New Canadian Cinema
Original Princess Cinema, Waterloo, Ontario

Full schedule of events is available at http://www.canadafilmdays.ca/

For advance online tickets:
http://www.eventbrite.com/org/1042044607?s=3747755

For interviews with the various directors and actors attending the festival or more information please contact John Tutt at 519 884-5112
Hope to see you there! 7:00 showtime.

A little dose of Fred will get you in the Christmas spirit! Get your tickets now! Advance tickets ($28) on sale at the Princess Twin Box Office and Old Goat Books in Waterloo. Phone sales (519)880-9595.
With Special Guests, the Gin Sisters. Cha Cha Cha.
Live on Stage at the Original TOMORROW. Canadian folk legend and brother of the late Stan Rogers. Advance tickets ($20) on sale now at the Twin and Old Goat Books.
Tickets now on sale ($20) at the Princess Twin Box Office and Old Goat Books. (519)880-9595.
Objectified, the new film from Helvetica director Gary Hustwit, comes to the Original Princess one night only. Thursday, May 20 at 7:00.

Canada 2010, 43 minutes. Directed by Peter Mettler.
PETROPOLIS: AERIAL PERSPECTIVES ON THE ALBERTA TAR SANDS is a hypnotic documentary that offers an unparalleled view of the Canada's most controversial natural resource. Produced by Greenpeace Canada and shot primarily from a helicopter, the film addresses the tar sands impact on the environment, yet it does so with the all stunning imagery that's become a Mettler trademark. WCI has a screen 35 feet wide and 15 feet tall, bigger than our screens at the Princess Twin. TO APPRECIATE THE SCALE OF THE TAR SANDS, WE DECIDED TO PRESENT THIS FILM ON THE BIGGEST SCREEN WE COULD FIND. WCI and Alternatives Magazine are assisting in this special presentation. Advance tickets are $10 and available for purchase at the Twin Box Office and Old Goat Books.
Tickets are limited. Available at the Twin Box Office or Old Goat Books. Scott Wicken will be opening this show.
